Reviews.Title: “Chick Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrandeSanJuan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back from a Greek Islands cruise and Venice on an overnight stay. The hotel is very chick, modern and clean. It is like a boutique hotel. I thought that it was in a different location, near Santa Ana, but it was still a short taxi ride to the center of town. I did not have time to explore the vicinities so, I cannot say much more than that it is a very good hotel with spacious rooms and comfortable modern bathrooms. The staff was very friendly and gave us tips and directions to where we wanted to go in such a short time. Oh, and very early in the morning ( like 6 a.m.) the room filled with smell of bacon. You decide whether that is good or not. I think that Marriotts' addition of the AC hotels, where I had not stayed before, gives the chain a welcome variety of alternatives in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SeveJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights while in Madrid on pleasure with family. It is a no-frills hotel with contemporary style. It has a great location for seeing the sites of the city, and a quiet atmosphere to retreat to after a busy day of business or activities. The hotel also has a very convenient attached, basement garage. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel for location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NomadatLarge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a city break - hotel is on a quiet street around the corner from Retiro park and the upmarket shopping area. Easy metro or bus from airport and can walk to just about anywhere (got the 17EUR ish three day travel pass at the airport - definitely worth it). Was glad to be away from the very touristy areas at the end of the day. Rooms modern and comfortable - heavy blackout drapes and proper aircon meant the room was cool even in the 40deg heat. Didn't eat at the hotel as there are plenty of places around - Mallorca cafe at the Calle Serrano end was great for a quick breakfast. Only down side was the lack of any PC for guest use - there is free wifi in the lobby but providing guests with a PC so they can check into flights etc is such a small thing that would be simple to fix. Staff were great through - and let me print a boarding pass on their computer. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service only average”
Reviews.Author: sydneyberlin
Reviews.Content: First time we stayed at an AC hotel and maybe booked it as it's part of the Marriott chain and very close to both most major tourist attractions and Madrid's gay area around Chueca. The rooms are okay but not great, very nice funky looking bathroom but unfortunately rather uncomfy beds with cheapish plastic-filled pillows. The Wifi in the rooms is an absolute rip off but at least you get free connection in the lobby area. Some of the staff were very nice but others weren't- we were unlucky to get checked in by a lady who was an absolute b#@%$ and got assigned one of the worst rooms in the building- level one, straight out to the street. Later at night, I left the room for a short time and upon my return the keycard didn't work anymore. Night clerk asked for the room number and re-cut the key without checking an ID or anything which didn't make me feel very safe at all!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Property”
Reviews.Author: willylabradoodle
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to be near the Center of Madrid/Plaza Mayor, etc. I found AC Recoletos online and checked TripAdvisor ratings. A friend used Marriot Points so we stayed for free at this property. While it is largely a business hotel (one suite), I never felt as if my family was unwelcome. The rooms are contemporary but not stark. The bed was comfortable enuff. I LOVED the bathroom which had nice fixtures, large personal-use products, plenty of towels, etc. Each room has a minibar with "free" beverages - beer/juice/soda/water (no spirits) so you didn't have to buy it. The small fitness room has a fridge with free flat/sparkling water for the taking. Free wifi in the stylish lobby which also had a nice bar area. One block from the chic Salamanca bario with mind-blowing shopping and restaurants. I'd stay here anytime. Great professional bilingual staff. Next time I'll stay at the Autograph Collection near Retiro Park which is in the same family of boutique hotels by Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sparty92
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the AC Recoletos hotel recently using Marriott points. It was a nice hotel and was fantastically situated in Madrid. I'd happily stay here again with or without points. Only issue was that the rooms have hardwood floors making things a bit louder in the room and hallways than I'd like, but that's why I always travel with earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “AC HOTEL RECOLETOS IN MADRID BEST AREA”
Reviews.Author: Moises1064230
Reviews.Content: Having lived and studied in Madrid gives one the opportunity of chosing the best value for a weekend hotel "escapada" to the capital. We´ve just spent a long weekend in Madrid celebrating my 60th birthday and attending the unforgetable Bruce Springteen´s concert at Bernabeu stadium (almost 4 hours of non stop dedicated performance by the Boss!!!). Ac Recoletos by Marriott: a 4 star hotel (there is a more expensive 5 star version at the other end of Acala Gate called AC Palacio del Retiro) Both Ac hotels are situated in the best area of Madrid: the "posh" quarter of barrio de Salamanca (a Spanish version the Parisian XVth Quarter). At AC Recoletos for less than € 180 you may live (at leat for a few days) just a few steps from Serrano Street and Castellana Avenue. It is the best and safest area in Madrid close to the Metro and the museums. Serrano is "fashion street" and the area has many good shops and restaurants ( we booked well in advance a table at the trendy Ten-kon-Ten - Paraguas Restaurant!!!). No need to worry about breakfast because in Serrano St. you have cafeteria Mallorca which is a more exclusive type of Starbucks. Around the corner there is a sophisticated place comprising restaurant, disco bar and terrace at Plaza de la Independencia and Alcala Gate called Ramses. The hotel has parking facility for some 22 € per day and the staff is young, helful and attentive. The hotel is modern, neat and clean. Most rooms have wonderful balconies looking onto the two corner streets. To be a "neighbour" of the calle Serrano does not require to become a "loaded" burgeois if only for a few days!!! I strongly recommend this hotel although if stopping over at the airport for one or two nights my choice has always been the Silken Puerta de America hotel where architecture and design are astonishing milestones. Ac hotel is more central and probably more convenient for a tourist but taxi fares to Puerta America are some 10 €.-

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and great location”
Reviews.Author: dort1gold
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights while in Madrid. Location ideal for walking to many popular areas and to quickly get to several metro stops. I am a devoted Marriott customer and this was a nice home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel Modern Hotel Great Location for Barrio de Salamanca”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: Very good modern hotel at a great location for Barrio de Salamanca. Subway around the corner. Calle de Serrano literally steps away. I love this area of town and I think this is one of the best 4 star hotels around this area. Typical 4 star service and rooms. No frills at all. Enjoy the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff were great”
Reviews.Author: Daryl K
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location right at center of downtown - easy to get to Sol/Mayor; Gran Via and the Salamanca areas. Staff couldn't have been more accommodating - especially Patricia and Monica who not only took care of reservations, but handled our complaints with grace. The hotel is clean, a bit spartan and perfectly adequate. That being said, the beds were not comfortable, we actually had to have one of the mattresses changed. And although there is a fitness center advertised, it is in a closet and has no equipment (not even sets of dumbbells). There are no dressers or drawers provided for folded clothing and the sink in the bathroom is "modern' and pretty disfunctional (can't get hands under faucet to wash them). We were going to stay a week, moved after 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “AC Hotels are great”
Reviews.Author: Esti11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several AC Hotels, they have just now joined Marriott hotels and you can use your Marriott rewards, in Spain and they are all wonderful. They are modern, clean and the service is great and the locations are also extremely. Their prices varies depending on the city but they are very comparable to other hotels and usually on the low side. All their hotels are similarly decorated so you know what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Mikel_Arteta
Reviews.Content: As many have commented, the location is perfect. Solid AC standard room and cleanliness, service could be a bit smilier and room service menu is quite limited. I stay in Madrid weekly for work and having tried many other hotels, AC Recoletos is my regular base now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location, just minutes from Cibeles, Museo del Prado, Parque del Retiro, Plaza de Alcala, 2.5 blocks from Retiro metro station. In 45 minutes you can walk from the hotel to Plaza Major, Opera, Palacio Real. The rooms are small as in most European Hotels. Front desk personnel are very good, helpful and they speak good English. This hotel falls short of the amenities expected for Marriott. The Fitness Center is equipped with one treadmill, two stationary bikes and 5 dumbbells (1, 2, 3, 3 and 6 kg). The A/C in the gym doesn't work, there is no TV and there is no water!. Bar and restaurant are mediocre. The library has less than 10 books. If you want a hotel to stroll thru Madrid and just go to sleep, this is the hotel. If you expect to spend some of your day in the hotel, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and great location”
Reviews.Author: hanibatutu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights and really loved this hotel. Its a business hotel and nothing very fancy in the lobby areas. But the room was spacious, clean and very modern. We got a queen sized bed, instead of two twins, which we have found to be a rare occurrence in our travels through Europe. The bathroom was especially large, clean and very nice. The location was fantastic too. Its in a quiet and safe alley that was filled with restaurants and bars, and yet the noise didn't trickle into our room at all. And it was a 10 minute walk to Retiro Park, the Prado, Puerta de Alcala, and Plaza de Cibeles. The metro was also close by but we just ended up walking everywhere instead. There was a small fitness center we used in the basement that was nothing special but nice to have anyway. And the staff was great and friendly. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Madrid but could have spent a week here”
Reviews.Author: Gbabigurl84
Reviews.Content: Had one night in Madrid waiting to fly home the following day after staying in Marbella the week before. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It is super central, we were able to easily walk to and from Puerta de sol, had an 8 Euro cab ride from the train station, and street was pleasantly quiet for a Friday night but still plenty of reasonably priced bars and dining. Hotel itself is modern but not overindulgent. Lobby has a pleasant gummy bear smell and resembles a W Hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. My traveling friends were super excited by the fact we had a free minibar which is definitely a nice touch. Room was clean and comfortable (we had three people in one room, and two in another room). Would definitely recommend and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “madrid trip”
Reviews.Author: dojsnowin
Reviews.Content: nice stay in madrid, great location and a wonderful front desk. thank Monica. she was so nice, we had two rooms and the entire family enjoyed our stay. really close to everything, we walked to all attractions. a little small, but all rooms are like that in spain. only thing wrong was i took some ice from the bar area and the lady came back and was very upset with me. i sorry but i did not speak spanish to explain i needed ice. the breakfast was the best and the mini bar was included. what a great extra.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: hanalei
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern hotel in an upscale part of town. It has two amenities I love: first, everything in the well-stocked mini-bar is free, and second, the lobby has the fastest wireless I have encountered in a hotel. I would avoid the restaurants recommended by the staff and go to La Cesta just a block away on the same street. Just across the street is a very inexpensive spot to have fresh croissants and coffee for breakfast. The rooms are well designed but somebody unfortunately cut costs on the mattresses which are thin and fail to offer support. Other negatives are the lack of services, such as check cashing or money exchange, plus many of the staff members obviously don't care to put themselves out to help or answer questions. On the whole, however, we enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Daniella S
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location because it is close to the center of Madrid but is in a quiet little street. Near the new City Hall, it is walking distance to the Prado Museum and other attractions and 2 metro stops to Plaza Mayor. The hotel staff provided great service and the room is modern and well kept. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business or pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: NC_mQk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located. Easy walking distance to major tourist attractions. Close to several metro lines an the Recoletos Cercanias station which has a direct train to the airport. Lots of good restaurants some are pricey especially the ones recommended by the hotel, but if you walk around the area you can find other more reasonably priced options. Overall a great hotel and I would stay here again when in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SandyBeachLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location if you are visiting Madrid for business or pleasure. Down a quite road in the centre if the city but in a nice old building. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern with easily accessible wi-fi throughout the hotel. Breakfast was buffet style but you can order additional but it really was adequate. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - Could Do Even Better Though”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: The AC by Marriott Recoletos is certainly a very good hotel indeed. It is modern - has rooms of good size, bright and airy. The free mini bar is fantastic and should be something for every hotel. Everything new, stylish, clean and bathrooms are spottlessThe location is excellent to say the least - could hardly be any better. The public areas are attractive and the historic building very nice. So why not an "Excellent" Rating? Because it could be better very easily if they only tried and did some minor things: Service - while ok - lacks the friendlyness and spirit you would expect from a Marriott hotel. The beds are cleary inferiour to the usual Marriott beds - no comparison! Not uncomfortable but again not quite there yet. Finally - a minor but still - Marriott Elite recognition is close to non-existent (Elite key holder but nothing else). Again while no major points the still point to a lack of attention to detail when it comes to service - something I found very atypical for Marriott as they usually exceed expectations especially in the areas critized above. I hope they address it - then this could be a truly excellent hotel. I would return though when in the area again - as all still rather minor points.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave L
Reviews.Content: We researched a lot of Marriott properties in Madrid finally settling on AC Hotel Recoletos. We stayed a couple of places on our trip and agreed that this was the best property due to the location. We used Marriott points for our stay (3 nights) and encountered no problems with the visit. The hotel is well situated to all transporation - and closest to the Airport bus that will take you directly for 2.50 EUROS. When going to the airport, make sure you find the right stop as it is not on the main stop, but on a small side street. It is a big Yellow bus that says Aeropuerto so you can't miss it and it runs during the week every 20 minutes. One note is the hotel is on a one-way small side street so no taxis usually go by...but you can find them on the main streeet around the corner. The decor of the hotel is modern and clean. We were able to share the room with 3 adults - they did charge for the extra person in the room, but provided a rollaway bed to make sure it was comfortable. The only downfall to the room was the bathroom was closed off from the room by frosted glass - which did not always provide the most privacy when in use (it was good that we knew each other well). I am sure you could get away without the fee, but like all European hotels - they don't like a lot of people in the room. Like all the AC hotels in Madrid, the mini-bar was free and wi-fi was available free in the lobby. There was no wi-fi access in the room (even for a fee). The front desk was very helpful with information on local shopping and dining. They spoke decent english, but appreciate if you try a little Spanish. They made restaurant reservations for us. Since it is close to high end shopping - most of the restaurants they suggest are rather pricey, but if you explore, there are plenty of places for all budgets. There are great little restaurants/pastry shops around the corner of the hotel for a nice breakfast and much cheaper than the 20 Euro for the hotel buffet. For great pastries and coffee - check out the place around the corner that has Brunch in capital letters out front. We found this an excellent place for a quick snack. Also - nice little restaurants around the corner for a quick bite to eat before heading out to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent one night stay”
Reviews.Author: K_Alice_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AC Recoletos for a very quick trip through Madrid with my dad and 5-year-old son and had a perfect trip. The hotel is close to one of the few stops for the airport bus (just 2 euros!) which was one of the main reasons I chose it. Just as importantly, it's an easy walk to some of the main sights of Madrid, including the lovely Retiro park, which my son adored. Upon arrival, one of the desk clerks talked us through a map of Madrid so we would have a better idea of where to go, as we were completely unfamiliar with Madrid. Only one staff member (who served us drinks in the bar area) didn't speak English, but she was friendly and we managed to communicate pretty well. The room had 3 single beds, just as I had requested (I had exchanged a few emails with the staff before my trip), and a large, well-equipped bathroom. Everything in the room was clean, new, in excellent condition. The mini-bar was free, which was a nice bonus. We also went to an amazing restaurant just a few steps down the street (I carried my sleeping son back to the hotel). No complaints - an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Funky property but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: GDP33
Reviews.Content: First impressions are positive. This hotel has a good central location near Retiro Park and a few high end boutiques in the exclusive Salamanca district of Madrid and has a funky, modern Spanish interior. Rooms are relatively spacious and well designed. The breakfast is great and in the evenings there are several great restaurants within a short walking distance of the hotel. However the hotel has several significant and unnessasary shortcomings which is surprising for a Marriott property. While there is free wifi in the hotel lobby, access to wifi in the rooms is only possible through the online purchase of a roaming card from a local Spanish telecoms provider. Their website is complicated, available in Spanish only and useless if you don't have a Spanish mobile telephone. Upshot was me losing around 15 USD trying to figure it out unsuccessfully. Could the concierge have helped? Maybe, but it has been years since I have come across such preoccupied, unhelpful and aggressive staff at reception in an international hotel (with the exception of the lady who manned the front desk in the evenings and went out of her way to be helpful). Her colleague Mirabel's calling is not in the hospitality industry. From the moment she cheerfully announced in Spanish to me after an overnight transatlantic trip that it would be hours before my room was ready (she insisted over the entire course of my stay to address me in Spanish even though I - who speak 3 languages fluently - struggle in the language and she speaks English well enough) I sensed that this grumpy lady was not in the slightest bit interested in making me feel welcome. Every request appeared to be a huge imposition and every offer of assistance half hearted: a request for directions to a gymnasium that would accept guests on a Sunday met with shruggs and eventually advice that there were a couple of gyms in the vicinity but that she neither knew if they were open nor whether they accepted non members (the gym in the hotel is frankly useless: a subterranean broom closet with a creaking treadmill and the meagre leftovers of what was once a complete set of dumbbells). She made a limp attempt at a couple of phone calls at my insistence but to no avail. Ultimately I found several options myself on the internet. I picked this hotel from many great options in Madrid because the promotional material said that it had wifi in the rooms and an onsite gymnasium (rare in Madrid). I have commented on how both are somewhat misleading statements and found no reason to return to this establishment. The rude morning front desk service staff make it hard for me to commend it to anyone else either.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: arielexposito
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, great location, attentive and professional service, clean and nice decor....free mini bar and great breakfast....................outstanding stay

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable Hotel in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: olivetreetravel
Reviews.Content: Rooms are excelent because they are spacious, table to work with the computer -but no free Wifi in the room, what you can get paying a card of 6 euros/hour (only in the Lounge you get free Wifi), free soft drinks in the frig., a funny bathroom, and non noise from the street, what means you can sleep comfortably. Is located near Plaza de Cibeles, Retiro park and the Prado, Reina Sofía and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums, and you have also many good restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard Y
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Although it is a Marriott, this is a boutique property. Rooms are chic like a "W" hotel. A staff that looks after you. The downside are the floors are wood. So you hear the neighbors above you. Breakfast is expensive. Room inlcudes items in the minbar. Eat breakfast across the street.

Reviews.Title: “AC Recoletos - CALLE de Recoletos in Madrid, not PASEO de Recoletos”
Reviews.Author: marsmadness
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. My only problem was FINDING it! Their website simply shows the address as Recoletos, 18. However, there is a Paseo de Recoletos and a Calle de Recoletos. If you use google maps, make sure and put in CALLE de Recoletos, or you will be going in circles. To make it more confusing, Calle and Paseo run into each other, so you could be very close to the hotel but on the wrong street. Other than that....the hotel is great

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ptk813
Reviews.Content: The location for our short visit to Madrid was ideal. We were in easy walking distance to the Museums, great restaurants, shopping and parks.This was our first experience with the AC Hotel Chain that is now Marriott and we enjoyed the service and friendliness of the staff. This level of the Marriott brand is ideal for business travelers, short stay travelers, etc. The rooms are very clean, but small, and not terribly well lit. I also had a difficult time with the internet connections. The breakfast room and meal is exceptional, but it is all or nothing and there is not the usually found Coffee Service in either your room or lobby. It is not 5 Star, but a solid 4. The staff was exceedingly helpful with reservations, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Phi1481
Reviews.Content: AC Recoletos is an excellent property, with very streamlined, modern and comfortable rooms and amenities. Wi-fi in the lobby is convenient, breakfast in the on-site restaurant is good, and as per usual with Marriott properties, the beds are extra comfy. It boasts a fantastic central situation in the upscale Recoletos neighborhood, adjacent to Puerta de Alcalá and directly across from the beautiful Parque del Buen Retiro. Access is very easy to the city's superb metro system, and its a relatively short (and lovely) stroll to many of the neghborhoods in and around the historic center, Puerta del Sol, the Prado Museum, Plaza Mayor, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a welcoming and centralized jumping off point for adventures in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “well located hotel with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTripster
Reviews.Content: Comfortable if a little strange hotel room (no windows only sky lights), nice bed and well equiped bath. Good neighborhood that is close to major attractions. Friendly staff. Breakfast starts at 8 which is a little late for anyone with early plans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: la_guera82
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern hotel situated in a very central location. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Terry0754
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a very nice area, close to everything. Clean and boutique feeling. Staff are wonderful, and Antraxa was wonderful and very helpful. Food was very good, fresh and all service was prompt. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: macnuno
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good. Modern and discreet. The rooms are very satisfactory size and how high is the ceiling give a sense of well being. The location is good for visiting the main museums and the area is quiet. Cleanliness is good and the staff helpful. The park is paid by the day and not paid by the hour. Breakfast is nice and very careful presentation. The mattress is not very comfortable. But highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Amazing Value!”
Reviews.Author: EstoppelGanger
Reviews.Content: The AC Recoletos is a beautiful building - inside and out - situated in what I would say is one of the best areas of Madrid. The hotel is within walking distance of the major attractions and museums. The Retiro Park and of course the fabulous shops of the Calle de Serrano are literally just around the corner. The hotel is also very conveniently situated for Recoletos RENFE station from where there's a regular train service straight to Barajas T4. Top tip - taking this train avoids the hassle of changing Metro lines and isn't nearly so busy. Spotless, modern and great value for money, I could not recommend the AC Recoletos highly enough and will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CASRunner
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. The room was very clean and nice, and we would definitely stay again. When we arrived there was some slight confusion about the number of nights we were staying, but once we got past that everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Hamwi
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Centrally located in Madrid with easy access to public transportation and the new train that goes to the airport. The rooms are spacious and modern. The well stocked (and free) minibar is a nice touch for the weary traveller who can come back to cold drinks in the room. A special mention to the two employees (Lidia and Xavi) who were friendly, professional and most helpful to us throughout our stay. They deserve much of the credit for the excellent experience we had at the hotel and in Madrid because of all the help and recommendations they offered with a friendly smile. They are both an asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice area!”
Reviews.Author: Gilda01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Madrid last July. The hotel is located in a very nice and quite area, the rooms are clean and modern, very comfortable. The staff is super nice and helpful. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet, as well as the Cafe across the street. The shops are from a walking distance, good restaurants too, Ramses was one of my favorites. I will definitely go back to Madrid and stay at this nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, smart comfort, kind staff”
Reviews.Author: ppascho
Reviews.Content: A very well located boutique business hotel, very quiet inside with not many people wandering around and during breakfast. I stayed there for 1 night on a quick business trip in town, and I even had time to stroll up and down Serrano and the Salamanca district on some free time since the hotel is located practically on Serrano. Highly recomend it for smart business travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, the rooms were newley remodled and clean. The bed and linens were comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The free mini-bar was a nice perk, there was not much in it but it was nice to have a cold water or a coke availible. The location is walking distance to the park and Prada, but there are not very may dining options around the hotel. But from the short time I was in Madrid I didnt see many areas with an abundance of restaurants. Oddly enough we ate at the Mexican restaurant on the same street as the hotel and the food was pretty good and the serveice was nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanie B
Reviews.Content: Great location, modern and clean rooms, so glad we stayed here. The front desk personnel and so kind, helpful, and willing to go above and beyond in service. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel with excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: akorea
Reviews.Content: More of an American-style business hotel but perfect for sightseeing. Excellent location near Cibeles Fountain and Puerta de Alcala, walking distance from Chueca area and very close to Recoletos short-distance train station. Clean, spacious, safe. Friendly staff in the front desk. With a small eatery almost in front of it, perfect to get some food for the go. Definetely a recommendation if you go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: guaman
Reviews.Content: Great location, modern, comfortable, clean room, great bathroom, friendly,helpful staff, good buffet bfast at a reasonable price.N

Reviews.Title: “Isn't this the hospitality industry?”
Reviews.Author: mydayjob
Reviews.Content: The reception we received was so distressing that we left Madrid after 2 nights. The receptionist did not honor our guaranteed 2 beds, even though we provided the written confirmation, stating that their reservation system was not connected to Marriott yet. No apology, nothing. He offered no options or alternatives. A rollaway bed was not even offered until the 2nd night. No maps offered, no restaurant recommendations, nothing. It was a total turn-off. The area is very high end and finding a meal without paying through the nose was impossible. The area is not a good place to be with kids. Everything shuts down early. Everything we inquired about was too much trouble for these folks. Would not recommend, even if the rate is attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaclyn719
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and a decent price in comparison to other hotels I saw online. The room was very nice and clean, and the free mini-bar was a life saver. After drinking lots of wine and sangria, it's great to be able to have a free water to grab in the middle of the night. The bathroom was the nicest I've seen in Europe, but a bit weird because the whole bathroom is enclosed with frosted glass. The door is also glass and does not have a lock or anything. This was fine with my spouse but would be a bit odd if traveling with family or friends. You can't completely see everything going on, but can definitely see the outline of the person in the bathroom. I don't think there were a ton of other guests staying at the hotel while we were there. The lobby is very quiet and there are not alot of people around to help with travel plans. The lobby does have free wi-fi, which is great. The location is in Salamanca, which is beautiful, high-end shopping district. The hotel is just minutes away from the lovely Retiro park. There are a few restaurants and cafes nearby, but not any of the popular sighseeing sights. If you like to walk, it's not bad at all. We didn't need to take the metro anywhere but walked a lot everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in the Salamanca area”
Reviews.Author: c0ke_o
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in AC Recoletos a few weeks ago. Receptionists did not hesitate to help us out. The hotel has sleek and modern decor. I also remember it smelled really good in the lobby. The room was very nice. Spacious enough for two and with a high ceiling. Queen size bed was very comfortable, airconditioning adjustable. Despite facing Calle Recoletos, it was always quiet. Bathroom was spotless and towels changed and toiletries replenished everyday. Would have been nice if there was an iron for clothes but it was ok. Central location near the Bus Turistico stops and around 3 metro stations so one is not far from anything! I think we got a pretty good rate online so we're not complaining about the price! It didnt include breakfast but there were a number of restaurants a short walk away so food wasn't a problem. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: drey188
Reviews.Content: The good: Convenient location - can walk to Retiro Park, the Prado, Plaza de Colon. The room wasn't big but had adequate space. The rooms and common areas were clean and maintained well by the staff. The free mini bar in the room was a big plus. And for the most, the front desk staff was quite friendly (3 different women manned the desk during my stay - the first was extremely helpful; the second polite though a bit inattentive; the third seemed like she was unhappy with her job) The bad: You must pay to get Internet access in your room. There is WiFi in the lobby area but it is frustratingly slow. Food at the hotel was overpriced so I didn't bother; there are plenty of dining options within walking distance. During my stay there was roadwork on the corner of the street so the noise in the morning was unbearable. Last downside for me (though I found this to be the case at every hotel I stayed at in Spain) was that there is no iron in the room. A minor detail, but I guess I'm used to American hotels where there is always one available. I would've gone out with wrinkly clothing but I was there on business so I had to look presentable. It cost me quite a bit to get shirts and pants ironed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and away from the traffic and noise of the Ritz area”
Reviews.Author: tractor290
Reviews.Content: I am responding on behalf of my wife....who was the solo traveller. Here are her comments....location was unbeatable, close to the Park, Prado, Metro, lost of restaurants, at the fringe of the business district (hence a lot quieter). The room was very acceptable.The service was very good. The staff's command of English was good enough to help her thru all her questions. The two things she recommends for improvements, 1) Offer a business center so that she can have access to the internet without bringing her own computer. 2) At $185 Euros per night, she feels that paying an extra $20 Euros for breakfast was a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ln2inSegovia
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the AC Recoletos in Madrid when my husband's friend came in from Norway. We live in Segovia, so we were looking for somewhere just for one night, ideally centrally located but not to cheap. This hotel fit all out criteria for the price range (although it was at the upper-end of our budget). It couldn't be in a better location. And, the rooms are well-kept, clean, modern, and functional. We were given two rooms (side-by-side) on the fifth floor. Ours was a little smaller (queen-size bed) and had a small window overlooking a very quiet courtyard. Our friend's had a sky light which had an automatic shade, but which couldn't be opened. His room was bigger, but didn't have a window other than the skylight. Overall, the staff was very helpful and the rooms very comfortable. I also liked the gimic of having a free mini-bar - although it only contained drinks. Still a nice perk. My only two negatives were: (i) the pillows were a bit stiff (not down), and (ii) you could hear the elevator shaft a bit from our room (on the fifth floor near the elevator).

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: FredvdFlier
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine, clean and a good breakfast. The service desk is dependent on who is standing a little distant. We stayed there for newyears eve. New Year's Eve was an unfriendly way at the bar closed to us. We were a group of 10 men with 6 bedrooms! Anyway, the location is excellent, easy to walk to the center! And nearby is also excellent! AC [not the first time in AC Hotels] continues to amaze me no free inter-net in the room, but free bar!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rafaelmarconato
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty good, in general I was very satisfed, just the services of concierge could be better and more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, lovely breakfast and good service”
Reviews.Author: Gratze
Reviews.Content: Apart from perhaps the world's smallest and most difficult to find gym, it is a lovely hotel with friendly staff, excellent extras (free mini bar) and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist design gone amok”
Reviews.Author: jsw78
Reviews.Content: This is a place where common sense and comfort were forgotten. There is not a single drawer in the room and very few surfaces to put things on (even the nightstands are mini-carts with lower shelf consisting of bars so things fall through). The closet is hanging space only and the rod for hangers is located extremely high (I am 164 cm tall and had difficulty using it, there is one long shelf sky high, above the rod, but not even my tall husband could reach there). The use of glass in the design of the bathroom is a separate story: the vanity is one sleek piece of glass with a tiny dent for the sink and absolutely nothing else. The hotel’s soap is a perfect little sphere but because there are no soap dishes, it keeps rolling off the vanity into the sink. The wall between the bathroom and the room is made of opaque glass. It does nothing for blocking light and sound, which with two people sharing the room is a huge problem (for example, on all our travels, when one of us is woken up by jet lag, we like reading in the bathroom without waking the other one up). On the positive side: location, strong hairdryers (a rarity in hotels!) and free minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: smcwtrip
Reviews.Content: This is our hotel everytime we go to Madrid on leisure, this was our 3rd time this year. We are very happy with the location, service and facilities. Only one details would make it even better, when I do the reservation the system recognize the credit card an all my details (name, address, etc) is completed authomatically and it is fantastic. But when you arrive to the hotel there is nothing in the system to inform the person at the reception that I've been there before, it would be a nice touch to greet me and say welcome back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: mctwist
Reviews.Content: We spend a weekend in Madrid and were looking for a stylish, centrally-located, convenient and fair value-for-money: all being found at AC Recoletos. Nice decor and good quality interior. As the hotel if off the main road "Serrano" its close to everything, but still quiet surrounding (the construction site mentioned in earlier comments has moved down the road is no issue anymore!). We highly enjyoed our stay and found the location ideal to start exploring as being located next to Retiro Park and in the middle between Salamance and Centro, so you can reach everything easily by foot or walk 2min to the close subway station!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clholbrook
Reviews.Content: My husband had work and I tagged along. We loved this hotel. The restaurant in the hotel is not worth the money and I would recommend eating at one of the many restaurants and delis in the neighborhood. The hotel is in a fantastic location and it you take a walk up the street and go around the corner you will find many beautiful shops and it reminded me of the stores you find in Beverly Hills. You have to stop at the big pastry shop/deli up the street, the name eludes me. Huge place on the corner with big windows. I highly recommend this hotel and my husband is going back for business and staying here again. It is in the best location and the staff is very friendly. The neighborhood is quiet and it's close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “REcommended”
Reviews.Author: DarrenWashington
Reviews.Content: A lovely modern hotel in an upscale neighborhood, quiet, yet only about a 10 minute walk to the Prado, etc. Once note: in September of 2010 the street in front of the hotel is being redone and the noise form the construction starts early and is very loud. I would request a room on a high floor away from the front of the hotel. As well, note that this hotel in on the Calle Recoletos, not the Paseo Recoletos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: anid2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in Aug/2010. The location of this hotel is great. We walked everywhere to all the attractions at all hours of the day. the hotel itself was clean, the staff were helpful and the rooms were nice and modern. The time that we were there, there was heavy duty contruction going on which started around 9. Obviously, not ideal, but it's not the hotel's doing. Despite the hotel from nearby construction, I throughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price. Too expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RunningA
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, well located in downtown. near the park to run, right price and good service. Too expensive 18 euros for a cup of tea and some bread and marmelade

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cattleya47
Reviews.Content: If you are familiar with AC hotels, you might conceivably be a bit disappointed by this one, although a "Seleccion". The location is quite allright. Bad luck, they were digging up the pavements of the street for electricity works, so everyone was awake at 8 o'clock, despite the double glazing. The lobby is very small and the bar was deserted at all times, which doesn't encourage you to have a drink and makes you want to get to your room as quickly as possible. The breakfast was very good. The standard rooms are a bit small compared to other AC hotels, although the price is higher. Seleccion hotels used to have a free bar at certain hours: no such feature visible at Recoletos. On the whole, I was quite disappointed by the general quality of the hotel and would have chosen another one, even for a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: smcwtrip
Reviews.Content: The last 3 times we have been in Madrid we were in this hotel. It is located right in the place you want to be if you want to enjoy the spirit of the city and to do some shoppings. Retiro Park is just 2 minutes away and you are in the middle of the best shopping area, restaurants and bars, without the noise and crowd of downtown. The size of the room was fine, clean and modern. The bathroom looks fantastic with glass walls the only downside is that the other person in the room can see you (not sexy!) so you can have fun if is your first trip together :-)) The staff is nice and make you feel pretty helpful, I am not sure about the live music in on Thursday in the tiny bar, when I arrived and saw the bar area was packed with people playing instruments I thought it was a private party, so we didn't join :-)))

Reviews.Title: “not yet ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMIAtraveller
Reviews.Content: the location is great, once the street construction is complete, which will be soon. when booking, was prompted to choose (1) terrace or (2) vaulted ceiling. Chose terrace, not neither. despite the fact (or maybe because of it) the hotel seemed mostly empty, service wasn't ready for prime time. Wi-fi in the room didn't work at all, no efforts were made to fix it. Being a new hotel, was surprised room desk was too small, holding TV, and had only 1 outlet oddly placed; inadequate for today's electronics. i had to work in the bar, using free wi-fi. i saw a library room, but no business center at all. breakfast was an additional charge, and overpriced, despite the room rate not discounted. i'm a fax of AC hotels, as they usually balance right contemporary interior design with adequate services for the business traveler. this seemed like a soft opening, in a soft economy. the room rate should reflect as much.

Reviews.Title: “great location, enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: greenstar10
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is its location, neatly tucked in a side street off of a main street so it's quiet but still centrally located. You can walk to city center in minutes. Hotel is charming, clean and modern. I paid about US$150/night and stayed for 3 nights. Overall I would give this hotel a 3 1/2 stars. Staff was good, service decent, (no one went out of their way but acceptable service, no complaints) room was clean and modern but the bathroom needs real walls not those opaque glass dividers that really provides no privacy. I traveled w/ my husband so not a big deal but if anyone else, it would have been real uncomfortable. That's my biggest issue. The beds are more like cots but I think that's the standard over there. Oh, the minifridge in the room has water bottles and juices and beer that are free of charge, that's a real plus. Overall, I had an enjoyable experience. There's a little coffee shop right outside the hotel that's a great pick me up every morning (they close on the weekend though).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: NelNay
Reviews.Content: THis is very nice and clean hotel. I really like it location. It's just a block away from Puerta de Alcala, Plaza de Cibeles and 2 blocks away from PRado Museum. THe only thing that wasn't so great is sound proofing between rooms, but it wasn't so terrible. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Lab-l
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly clean. Rooms and bathrooms have great sizes. The breakfast is really poor and expensive, I would suggest you to take breakfast at Delina's wich is right in front the hotel. They have huge variety of food at great quality and price. My mom and I took a poor breakfast at the hotel por 18euros each and the next day a great breakfast at Delina´s for 3euros each. The staff is pretty helpfull but if you wish to eat at the hotel bar be prepared to wait a lot as there is only one waitress to attend the whole bar and room service! The location is ok, the hotel street has a lot of restaurantes but I would suggest you to go to Mallorca Pasteleria wich is right across calle serrano, there you can have a great snack, breakfast or lunch. The hotel is only a 2 minutes walk from Plaza de La Independencia where you can take the Madrid Vision tourist bus.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: JustinLisboa
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet street in Salamanca shopping area but at a walking distance from most of Madrid hotspots. Elegant design, comfortable, clean and wide enough rooms at a fair price. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, better for couples than family”
Reviews.Author: S&JGill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it's directly opposite family and so it was for its location more than anything. It's a lovely hotel in a great location and would be lovely to go for a romantic weekend break, but we had our 6 month baby with us and so the room wasn't the best family room, in addition the cot we were given had a broken leg and the hotel would not provide us with a kettle to boil the baby water, they insisted that we ring up every time we needed hot water which is quite often so we ended up buying a cheap kettle ourselves! The breakfast is extremely expensive at nearly 20 Euros each, so if it is not included in your room rate I would recommend walking out and finding somewhere nice nearby. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples, however the bathroom is behind frosted glass walls with a door that doesn't shut properly so if you like your privacy in the bathroom it isn't ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, room, service, city”
Reviews.Author: LoloTravels
Reviews.Content: This is the second AC Hotel I've stayed at (the first was in Milan in May), and from now on, AC will be my go-to hotel when in Spain and Italy. I stayed six nights, the first four nights on business and then an additional two to see the city. Gorgeous historic building combined with clean modern design; lovely and sizable room with balcony on side street; great service; terrific location just off Paseo de Recoletos and a few minutes from Plaza de Cibeles. And although I've never been much of a mini-bar user, it's awfully nice to come back at the end of the day and grab a mineral water or juice or beer from the free mini-bar without worrying about being charged piles of money for it. Can't say enough good things about this hotel in particular or AC in general.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DubCM
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, in a good location, close to Retiro Park and within easy access of all the major museums. The metro is easy to negotiate and there is a couple of stops close to the hotel. You can use the metro to get in from the airport or a taxi costs 25 euro. The lobby is bright and spacious; the staff are very helpful and friendly. My room was modern, the bathroom was big, while the glass wall between the bathroom and the room is a bit strange. I ordered a continental breakfast in my room each morning so I can’t say what the full breakfast was like, but what I had was very good. The mini bar in the room is complementary, which I have never seen before. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money it costs, tiny rooms and bad service!”
Reviews.Author: cla114
Reviews.Content: I have always considered AC hotels as a great chain of luxury and business hotels and in the past I was never disappointed, this time I was shocked! For 217 euros (and it was a special offer!) they gave me a tiny double room (and I was alone, imagine if we were two!) about 3mX5m, with a bathroom inside (divided by a glass). The reception was absolutely unfriendly, breakfast was nothing special, in the free minibar they had an orange juice and a couple of cokes, and the hotel in itself is really small. Nothing against it if it costed 100-130 euros, like the Hotel Bauza or other boutique hotels, but when it goes above 200 euros I expect something different!

HotelInfo.Name: AC Hotel Recoletos by Marriott
HotelInfo.Address: Recoletos 18, 28001 Madrid, Spain
